column4: would you have any insight into the Atheros chipset in Intrepid?
mine works out of the box
used linux restricted modules
mine too ... but not very well ...
what is the default driver that Ubuntu uses for the Atheros wifi chip?
http://paste.ubuntu.com/76727/
thats what it says from lshw -C network
this is what mine says   http://pastebin.com/d69b79058
looks fine
yeah ... just that my wifi never connects automatically ... and I have to refresh the network list manually for it to see anything at all
do you use any other wifi except this one/
none
you could always manually configure /etc/network/interfaces to be configured for the only wifi it connects to. The app will the be redundant and it will connect without scanning
should I try compiling madwifi?
no need, the connection works fine. If you enter the connection details into /etc/network/interfaces it will connect fine
http://www.cyberciti.biz/faq/setting-up-an-network-interfaces-file/
will it? cause it looks like the card sees nothing unless I manually refresh the wireless networks list
that will help ^
maybe adding the command to sudo iwlist scan will help (not graceful but may solve it)

apt-get has never failed me yet, its all i sue
